subject: Ethics
title: Emergency Exceptions
description: A quick win: understand Emergency Exceptions.

hook.text: You're unconscious after a car crash. A surgeon operates without your consent. Is that ethical?

buildup.text: Informed consent requires a conscious, willing patient. Emergencies don't wait for either.

discovery.text: The emergency exception allows doctors to treat unconscious patients if delay would cause death or serious harm.

twist.text: But what if the patient carries a 'do not resuscitate' order in their wallet that the ER team never finds?

climax.text: The exception assumes most people would want to be saved. That assumption is usually rightâ€”but not always.

punchline.text: When you can't ask, doctors assume 'yes.' Usually, they're right.

quiz.question: What does the emergency exception to informed consent allow?
options: Doctors can treat unconscious patients if delay would cause death or serious harm
Doctors can perform any procedure they want during emergencies
Emergency rooms don't need to follow any ethical guidelines
